channel.title: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color
channel.description:
Pretty much all i need now is a cache extractor then a wrl convertor
[b]Models included:[/b] dfull, dchain, kalphiteBody, KalphiteLegs, cape
It can import .wrl .3ds and .obj but you cant see 3ds or obj unless there huge.
Im not sure why the colors are inverted on the skillcape and KQ [img]http://img145.imageshack.us/img145/1570/kqrl0.png[/img]
[img]http://img224.imageshack.us/img224/2443/capeii2.png[/img]
[img]http://img224.imageshack.us/img224/7610/dragonat2.png[/img]

item.title: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Seriously .mdl and .dat are just different extension names.
Load a .mdl and .dat with the same model number into any Hex editor and compare them byte for byte, they’ll be the same.
You can rename them .mop if you like…

Google ‘cacheexport.zip’ , old but still useful.

Read full topic

item.title: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

When i export any model directly from your model viewer to .wrl and import with a VRML loader, it has only one color, its base color. Which for a attack cape would be red. But i’ll try again, knowing me i have a tendency to fuck up.

Just tried, the only color i could see was the pink on the attack skillcape

Read full topic

item.title: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

3ds, VRML apparently does not support multitexturing. I textured the KQ myself my making the antennas, and the legs a separate object from the body, all exported into 3ds.

Read full topic

item.title: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:28, topic:219490”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=288318.msg2331620#msg2331620 date=1215917555]

yes to convert a .mdl to a .dat you just change the extension, the format is really whats changed.

How can you convert a .mdl file to a .dat file?

Sillvia, I think thats his name, from moparscape a long time ago included a .mdl to .dat converter in his cache extractor.

[/quote]
Judging by that failed quote, i think you said “It was a batch file that renamed *.mdl to *.dat. So, no.”

It was an exe[/quote]Oops. Didn’t notice that.

Then it was some idiot who programmed a file renamer in C/C++/etc.

Read full topic

item.source: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color

item.title: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:25, topic:219490”][quote author=Frell link=topic=288318.msg2331538#msg2331538 date=1215914432]

The .dat and .mdl are the same format, just different file name extensions.
in dos :- rename *.mdl *.dat

It’s just because someone wanted to call them .dat and someone else wanted to call them .mdl

Hope that clears it up, cater for both extensions.

P.S. Nice program.

doubt the formats are the same, but would you happen to have a cache extractor?
[/quote]
there is only one format, they just have different extensions coz moparscapers are idiots…
anyway i would ask silab, she knows everything about rs models[/quote]
I’ve asked her, she didn’t reply =\ I found that VRML supports coloring, but not multicoloring, which is needed in runescape models. So im trying to find a different format

Read full topic

item.title: My 2nd model viewer 2nd BETA version - supports color
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:21, topic:219490”][quote author=Niall link=topic=288318.msg2331362#msg2331362 date=1215907760]

yes to convert a .mdl to a .dat you just change the extension, the format is really whats changed.

How can you convert a .mdl file to a .dat file?
[/quote]

i meant to say that the extension does not equal the format, the extension can be changed at any time but if the format does not change it still a model file[/quote]

Perhaps I’m having a go at the wrong person.

[quote=“Frell, post:20, topic:219490”][quote author=Niall link=topic=288318.msg2331362#msg2331362 date=1215907760]

yes to convert a .mdl to a .dat you just change the extension, the format is really whats changed.

How can you convert a .mdl file to a .dat file?
[/quote]
Sillvia, I think thats his name, from moparscape a long time ago included a .mdl to .dat converter in his cache extractor.[/quote]

I find it hard to believe it did anything other than rename the file, considering .dat has no specific structure, meaning it can be anything.

Read full topic
